subject: RE: [junit] ClasspathWalker (even better)
msgSnippet: ... classpath. ... This is pretty much exactly what I have. I ve broken the code inside each of these aspects into other (bite sized) unit tests also, so I
messageBody:
J.B. re-wrote:

>I suggest testing each of these behaviours in isolation.
>
>* The ClasspathWalker correctly walks the classpath.
>* The ClasspathWalker correctly generates events as it walks the
classpath.
>* The ClasspathWalkerListener correctly handles the various kinds of
>ClasspathWalker events
>

This is pretty much exactly what I have. I've broken the code inside each of
these aspects into other (bite sized) unit tests also, so I think I have a
fair covering w/o too much overlap. That all said, I have an API to my
users. I "present them a result" based off walking a classpath, handling
what I find, and then doing a number more things, let's say N of them. I
have unit tests for each of these N.

At the end of the day I want to "unit test" my API, I want to know that if
user passes my X/Y/Z I will do A/B/C (having done those steps in the
middle). That said, if any of my internals fail then "aggregating/higher
level" code will break. Why get multiple failures, when one (lower level)
might save me analysing/debugging time?

regards

Adam
